Comments_List: How to look at concepts through analytical models
macro techniques but from a growth/development perspective
knowledge of new macroeconomic models and pertinent mathematical skills
I learned lots of macroeconomics model and the ability to compare different models.
Growth models
I learned various models that were useful to understand macroeconomic phenomena. I especially enjoyed professor Zilibotti's explanation of growth in China.
concepts relevant to understand grand macro questions
Basic knowledge of Macroeconomics.
Developed skill in macroeconomics
advanced macro level understanding of productivity and the relative factors
Macro insights and knowledge about the professor's research in China
Macro econ concepts.

Strengths - Fabrizio is a great professor and he really tries to make concepts accessible to all levels of learners. 
Improvements - Not providing solutions to problem sets except in-person during TA sessions makes revision for exams really hard. With a limited time in the TA session to cover often lengthy problem sets, most solutions are glossed over and only areas where a majority of the class is confused get addressed.

Interesting topics
Good mix of empirical evidence 
Answers should be provided with problem sets - makes it very difficult to learn 
Structure of the final exam should be accurately communicated beforehand
More explanation/labeling of variables in the course powerpoints
Strengths: The material is very abundant
Very patient TA and professor

The strengths include professor Zilibotti's clarity and wilingness to answer questions without leaving any stone unturned. He also recommended a few papers that I found quite interesting. I would prefer that this course be less presentation-based, as it was sometimes hard for me to follow the quantitative content. I would also add more content on the study of growth in middle and low income countries.

The strength of the course was its broad coverage. I learned various topics regarding the development macroeconomics.
However, at the same time , the course just covered the introductory part of each topic. Some important topics could be dug down deeper for more advanced understanding.
Useful course, deep survey of macroeconomic methods, strong teaching and TA

The instructor's slides are very sketchy. They are not detailed enough to enable a student to revise adequately. He has asked us to supplement with a book but then again, there are some topics which are there just in his slides and not the given books.

If you want to learn about macro theory and have a background in macro already, then this a good course to take but you will struggle with the analytical parts if you have not previously done some more advanced math classes
Yes if interested in subject matter
Yes! This course is really interesting!
Would appreciate more engagement than PS and lectures
I highly recommend this course.
Yes
I recommend this course for students who are interested in development economics and macroeconomics.
Certainly.
Would recommend only if interested in macro
